snippet: When Republicans pledge to slash federal spending, they ignore that government is necessary for big projects that voters care about.
abstract: When Republicans pledge to slash federal spending, they ignore that government is necessary for big projects that voters care about.
lead_paragraph: MANCHESTER, N.H.--There was a little-noticed moment in Saturday's Republican debate that perfectly illustrated why Mitt Romney is having a hard time persuading ordinary voters that he cares about their concerns.

headline.main: Romney's Big Government Critique Runs Into a New Hampshire Roadblock
